intro: Dissochaeta ramosii, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
